column5: After way more work than I expected the new 12'X24' home for the hovercraft is up and finished!!! Even fired her up today. She runs mint!!! Next project get the boat ready.
Isn't this the time of year you want to be using the hover craft?  S.
Should be. Will be using it in the fall during ice up. Too much work to do right now to be playin'
Never mind a bow-mount motor Dave, get a bow-mount .50 calibre machine gun! Doug
Bought through govt. auction in the US. Just need to run down to Wisconsin and pick it up.
LOL Sweet! The Polar Bear Express!!
I can now get out to the cabin 365 days a year.
I figured that why you'd want it. Very slick machine Dave...you'll have to post some videos once you get it into action. Congrats.
That is just too cool ....
when do we install the downriggers?
That is super cool Dave
I'm thinkin' it could use a bow mounted trolling motor.
Nice toy
Nice grab for sure. You should find that it is well maintained being a County vehicle they get an amazing amount of care. Art
Wonder what it's like going up any hills?
They don't side hill but can go up hill fairly well. I just hope it will climb the hill to the cabin once it's graded and graveled. Got a parking spot for it under the deck.
I think I saw that thing in Star Wars lV!
Nice,  you can just slide over to anyone with a portable hut and blow him out of your favourite spot...
While doing donuts around them!!!!
that is sweet! Plus the girls will think you are a fireman...that goes a long way
that is amazing
No Brakes!!!! Have a blast with that thing... but be sure you don't put your foot through the floor lookin for the brakes! HH
FYI, it does have brakes. The lever on the left side controls shutters that close of rear directed air.
Where's the trolling motor going, bow or stern? ???
I am no expert; but that sounds more like neutral than brakes...
If you really want to stop in a hurry you spin it 180 degrees and it'll stop.
If the engine stalls on the water does it float?
That's where you start blowing ?
UH, yes. It's a boat that flies. 3:28 in he starts and stops on the water.
